text: hello I'm David Pogue and every week
it's my job to test out electronics for
your benefit doesn't matter what
personal sacrifices I have to make so
when it came time to review digital
underwater cameras I thought there's
only one good place to really test them
out near the water what it dude aura in
the water now most people never take
pictures at the beach or the water park
or the pool because they're too worried
about ruining their expensive digital
cameras but these cameras were made to
go underwater this Sony tx5 for example
is totally amazing it's so thin you
can't even tell it's an underwater
camera it turns on instantly and it's
got a great touch screen but here's my
favorite you can whip the camera around
you and it builds a panorama
automatically talk about wide-angle just
to disappointments sometimes the photos
are weirdly washed out like these and
sometimes they distort people's heads
like this one the panasonic lumix ts2 is
a little blocky but the pictures look
better and it's a video superstar it has
a separate button for shooting movies so
you don't have to switch modes for video
and it can zoom while you're filming and
the videos look great but I've saved
what may be the best feature of these
cameras for last bear drop through
now a word of caution panasonic says
this camera is good for use down to 33
feet under water and they're not kidding
I went scuba diving with it hoping to
take pictures of some sharks that were
at 45 feet and it completely stopped
working right at 33 feet this is the
closest I could get to the Sharks the
camera the Sony is good for down to only
10 feet so my advice get this panasonic
it rocks well I hope you've enjoyed this
look inside how I will suffer to bring
you the news hope you'll join me next
week when i'm going to review fireproof
DVD players actually I'm kind of sure
I'm going to be out of town next week
Oh
